organization.name: MetroFlex Events
organization.relationship_to_gym: MetroFlex Events is the competition production arm. The Original MetroFlex Gym (founded 1987, Arlington TX) is the training facility that produced Ronnie Coleman and other champions.
organization.mission: Texas-based event production company specializing in organizing bodybuilding and fitness competitions through the National Physique Committee and NPC USA Texas
organization.unique_positioning: Direct connection to Ronnie Coleman legacy and MetroFlex Gym's 38+ year champion-making history

brian_dobson.responsibilities: Runs the gym, trains clients, promotes NPC competitions
brian_dobson.legacy: Trainer of 8x Mr. Olympia Ronnie Coleman
brian_dobson.achievements: Founded MetroFlex Gym 1987, produced 25+ IFBB Pro Card winners

metroflex_ronnie_coleman_story.introduction: Fellow police officer Gustavo Arlotta suggested Coleman visit MetroFlex Gym
metroflex_ronnie_coleman_story.brian_dobson_first_impression: The veins in his arms were poking through very distinctly, and in his legs as well
metroflex_ronnie_coleman_story.the_famous_offer: Brian Dobson offered Coleman a free lifetime membership if he allowed Dobson to train him for the upcoming 1990 Mr. Texas bodybuilding competition

first_competition.result: Won both his class and overall title

career_progression.status: Arguably the greatest bodybuilder of all time

training_stories.equipment_evolution: Ronnie became so strong that MetroFlex didn't have heavy enough dumbbells. He was doing sets of 20-25 reps on dumbbell press, so Brian started buying bigger and bigger dumbbells.
training_stories.200lb_dumbbells: When Brian finally got 200lb dumbbells for Ronnie, he remembers Ronnie really being able to man handle the weight
training_stories.special_equipment: Brian Dobson had to buy equipment specifically for Ronnie so he could keep pushing himself further

metroflex_ronnie_coleman_story.lasting_impact: Ronnie Coleman still maintains connection to MetroFlex. The Ronnie Coleman Classic event honors this legendary partnership.
metroflex_ronnie_coleman_story.free_lifetime_membership: Coleman won Mr. Texas as agreed, earning free lifetime training at MetroFlex - a promise kept to this day

raw_power_wild_game_feast.event_type: Raw Bench Press and Deadlift + Wild Game Feast
raw_power_wild_game_feast.description: Raw Power & Wild Game Feast combines powerlifting competition with MetroFlex's legendary Wild Game Feast
raw_power_wild_game_feast.food: Wild Game Feast featuring deer, elk, wild boar & more
raw_power_wild_game_feast.charitable_focus: 100% of proceeds support Open Door Church's Mexico Mission & SPARK International
raw_power_wild_game_feast.atmosphere: Compete in the atmosphere that forged champions for over 38 years
unique_aspects: Held at the actual Original MetroFlex Gym (sacred ground for bodybuilding)

npc_better_bodies_mutant_classic.pro_card_opportunity: Winners of overall titles can earn qualification toward national shows where IFBB Pro Cards are awarded
npc_better_bodies_mutant_classic.additional_competitions: Power Pairs - Crossfit competition scheduled during event

services_offered.hair_makeup: Professional hair and makeup services available
services_offered.photography: Physique Visuals - Professional photography, videography, and live streaming
services_offered.check_in: Athlete check-in information available on website

npc_ronnie_coleman_classic.legacy_connection: Honors 8x Mr. Olympia Ronnie Coleman's legendary connection to MetroFlex Gym and trainer Brian Dobson
ronnie_coleman_achievements: Trained at MetroFlex Gym by Brian Dobson
Won first competition (Mr. Texas 1990) after just 6 months of prep
Arguably greatest bodybuilder of all time

registration.competitor_entry: NPC competitor entry available through MuscleWare

npc_branch_warren_classic.legacy_connection: Honors Branch Warren, another legendary MetroFlex athlete known for hardcore training
branch_warren_achievements: Known for intense, hardcore training style

services_offered.media: Photo, video, and livestream coverage via Physique Visuals

npc_organization_info.description: The premier amateur physique organization in the world
npc_organization_info.role: Stepping stone to IFBB Professional League

notable_achievements.olympia_winners: 24 Olympia winners came from NPC ranks
notable_achievements.arnold_classic_winners: 38 Arnold Classic winners came from NPC ranks

npc_organization_info.membership_requirement: NPC card required to compete in any NPC competition
npc_organization_info.how_to_get_npc_card: Available at npcnewsonline.com or purchase at event (higher fee at event)
npc_organization_info.path_to_pro: Win overall title at NPC National Championship to earn IFBB Pro Card

mens_bodybuilding.description: Classic bodybuilding focused on maximum muscle mass, symmetry, and conditioning
mens_bodybuilding.posing_requirements: 7 mandatory poses + optional individual posing routine
mens_bodybuilding.suit_requirements: Posing trunks (solid color, no logos, 50% glute coverage minimum)

classic_physique.description: Golden Era aesthetic - V-taper, symmetry, balanced proportions. More size than Men's Physique but not extreme mass of Bodybuilding
classic_physique.weight_limit_enforcement: Competitors must not exceed maximum weight for their height. If over weight, must move to Bodybuilding or Men's Physique
classic_physique.height_classes_note: Four distinct height classes at competitions, though number may vary based on entries
classic_physique.posing_requirements: 7 mandatory poses + 60-second posing routine with music

mens_physique.description: Focus on marketability, conditioning, overall aesthetic. Board shorts, no mandatory poses, emphasis on V-taper and stage presence
mens_physique.height_classes_note: Number of height classes subject to change and may be combined if low entries
mens_physique.posing_requirements: No posing routine. Only comparisons and individual quarter turns
mens_physique.suit_requirements: Board shorts just above knee, solid color or simple patterns, no branding/logos

womens_bodybuilding.description: Maximum muscle mass and development for women, similar judging to men's bodybuilding
womens_bodybuilding.posing_requirements: 7 mandatory poses + individual posing routine with music

figure.description: Athletic, toned physique with muscle shape but softer than Women's Physique. Emphasis on femininity and proportion
figure.posing_requirements: Quarter turns only (no mandatory poses or routine)

bikini.description: Focus on overall appearance, balance, shape, skin tone. Softest division with minimal muscle definition
bikini.posing_requirements: Model walk and quarter turns (no mandatory poses)

wellness.description: Emphasis on lower body development (glutes and legs) with fit upper body. Athletic and balanced look
judging_criteria: Balance and shape (emphasis on glutes and legs)

womens_physique.description: More muscle mass than Figure, less than Women's Bodybuilding. V-taper and athletic development
womens_physique.posing_requirements: Mandatory poses + individual posing routine with music

wheelchair.description: Open to competitors who use wheelchairs. Judged on upper body development
wheelchair.posing_requirements: Adapted poses suitable for wheelchair athletes
wheelchair.suit_requirements: Standard posing attire for chosen division

npc_card_requirement.purpose: NPC membership card required to compete in any NPC competition
npc_card_requirement.how_to_obtain: Available at npcnewsonline.com or purchase at event
npc_card_requirement.cost_difference: Higher fee if purchased at event vs online in advance
npc_card_requirement.recommendation: Purchase online before event to save money

registration_process.late_fees: Apply for registrations close to event date

competition_day_schedule.weigh_in_rules: Must make weight within 30-minute window. If over, may need to move divisions
competition_day_schedule.prejudging_vs_finals: Prejudging determines placings through comparisons. Finals feature individual routines and awards presentations

posing_music.submission_deadline: Typically 1 week before event (check specific event)
posing_music.submission_method: Upload via event website or email to event coordinator
posing_music.backup_recommendation: Bring USB drive with music to event as backup

required: Tanning products or spray tan appointment
not_allowed: Outside food in certain backstage areas (varies by venue)

tanning_rules.requirement: All competitors must have competition tan (mandatory)
options: ProTan USA onsite spray tan (available at MetroFlex Events)
Self-applied tanning products (Jan Tana, Liquid Sun, Dream Tan)
Professional spray tan services booked in advance
tanning_rules.color_guideline: Dark enough to show muscle definition under stage lights
tanning_rules.application_timing: Night before or morning of show (allow dry time)
tanning_rules.onsite_service: ProTan USA available at all MetroFlex Events

pro_card_qualification.requirement: Win overall title at NPC National Championship
pro_card_qualification.qualification_path: Place well at regional/state shows (like MetroFlex Events) → Earn qualification to compete at nationals → Win overall at nationals → Earn IFBB Pro Card
pro_card_qualification.metroflex_events_role: All three major MetroFlex Events (Better Bodies, Ronnie Coleman, Branch Warren) are National Qualifiers
pro_card_qualification.pro_cards_awarded_through_metroflex: 25+ athletes trained at MetroFlex Gym have earned IFBB Pro Cards
pro_card_qualification.post_pro_card: Eligible to compete in IFBB Pro League shows (Olympia qualifiers, Arnold Classic, etc.)

audience_demographics.geographic_reach: Texas statewide + Oklahoma, Louisiana, Arkansas, New Mexico competitors
audience_demographics.competitor_spending_power: Average competitor spends $500-1,500 per competition (entry, travel, services)

benefits: Presenting sponsor status (event named after brand)
Maximum logo placement (stage, backdrop, programs, website)
Inclusion in all press releases and media

roi_expectations.audience_quality: High-intent buyers actively investing in fitness lifestyle

activation_opportunities.vendor_booth: Set up booth in expo area, interact directly with competitors and spectators
activation_opportunities.product_sampling: Distribute samples, demo products, offer event-exclusive discounts
activation_opportunities.athlete_partnerships: Connect with competitors for brand ambassador relationships
activation_opportunities.social_media_content: Create content featuring event, tag MetroFlex Events for amplification
activation_opportunities.speaking_opportunities: Higher tiers can present seminars or speak at event
activation_opportunities.awards_presentation: Present awards in your sponsored division for photo opportunities

10_steps_to_success.title: Choose Your Division
10_steps_to_success.description: Research NPC divisions, assess your physique honestly, select division that matches your build and goals
10_steps_to_success.resources: Review division rules at npcnewsonline.com, watch past competition videos, consult with coaches

10_steps_to_success.title: Select Your Event
10_steps_to_success.description: Pick a MetroFlex Events show (Better Bodies, Ronnie Coleman, or Branch Warren Classic) based on date that gives adequate prep time
10_steps_to_success.recommendation: Better Bodies Classic in April is great season opener. Ronnie Coleman Classic in May for more prep time.

10_steps_to_success.title: Get Your NPC Card
10_steps_to_success.description: Purchase NPC membership card online at npcnewsonline.com (cheaper than buying at event)

10_steps_to_success.title: Hire a Coach (Highly Recommended)
10_steps_to_success.description: Find qualified prep coach for diet, training, posing, and strategy guidance
10_steps_to_success.where_to_find: Contact brian@metroflexgym.com for coach referrals in Texas

10_steps_to_success.title: Create Your Meal Plan & Training Program
10_steps_to_success.description: Work with coach to design contest prep diet and training split
10_steps_to_success.typical_approach: High protein, strategic carb cycling, progressive cardio, weight training 5-6x/week

10_steps_to_success.title: Order Your Posing Suit
10_steps_to_success.description: Purchase division-appropriate suit from reputable vendor (allow 4-6 weeks for custom suits)
10_steps_to_success.vendors: Angel Competition Bikinis, Suits by J'Adore, Musclewear, etc.

10_steps_to_success.title: Practice Posing
10_steps_to_success.description: Learn mandatory poses (if applicable), practice transitions, build stage presence
10_steps_to_success.timing: Start 8 weeks out, intensify final 2 weeks
10_steps_to_success.recommendation: Film yourself, get coach feedback, practice in posing suit

10_steps_to_success.title: Register for the Show
10_steps_to_success.description: Complete online registration via MuscleWare or event website
10_steps_to_success.tip: Register early to lock in lower fees

10_steps_to_success.title: Prepare Music (If Applicable)
10_steps_to_success.description: Create 60-second posing routine music for divisions requiring it
10_steps_to_success.format: MP3 or WAV on USB drive
10_steps_to_success.submission: Upload to event website 1 week before show

10_steps_to_success.title: Final Week Preparation
10_steps_to_success.description: Peak week protocol (water/sodium manipulation), hair/makeup plan, pack all items, visualize success
10_steps_to_success.checklist: Confirm tanning appointment, pack posing suits, prepare music backup, book hotel, plan meals

common_mistakes: Starting prep too late (need 12-16 weeks minimum for first show)
Not practicing posing enough (should be daily habit)
Wrong suit size or style (order early and try on)
Forgetting to submit posing music by deadline
Not getting dark enough tan (stage lights wash you out)
Arriving late to weigh-ins (30-minute window only)
Dehydrating too much (can look flat instead of shredded)
Not reading division rules carefully (disqualification risk)
Skipping the NPC card (can't compete without it)
Not having backup plans (extra suit, music on USB, etc.)

mental_preparation.expectations: Understand this is a learning experience. Few people win their first show. Focus on execution.
mental_preparation.nerves: Nervousness is normal. Use it as energy. Practice visualization and deep breathing.
mental_preparation.comparison: Don't compare yourself to seasoned competitors. Compare to YOUR last photo from 12 weeks ago.
mental_preparation.support_system: Bring friends/family for encouragement. Competition day is long and emotional.
mental_preparation.perspective: Win or lose, you've achieved something 99% of people never attempt. Be proud.

faq_quick_reference.do_i_need_npc_card: Yes, NPC card is mandatory to compete. Purchase at npcnewsonline.com before event for lower cost.
faq_quick_reference.can_i_compete_in_multiple_divisions: Yes, you can enter multiple divisions. Each division requires separate registration and fee.
faq_quick_reference.what_if_i_miss_weight: You have 30-minute window at weigh-ins. If over weight for Classic Physique, you can move to Bodybuilding or Men's Physique.
faq_quick_reference.do_i_need_coach: Not required but highly recommended for first-timers. Coaches handle diet, training, posing, peak week strategy.
faq_quick_reference.can_spectators_attend: Yes! General admission and reserved seating tickets available. Great atmosphere for supporters.
faq_quick_reference.how_long_does_show_last: Full day event. Prejudging ~10AM-2PM. Finals ~7PM-9PM. Competitors should plan to be present all day.
faq_quick_reference.can_i_take_photos_with_competitors: Yes during breaks and after finals. Respect backstage areas (competitors only).
faq_quick_reference.is_there_prize_money: Typically no cash prizes at regional shows. Winners receive trophies. National shows may have prize money.
faq_quick_reference.how_do_i_qualify_for_nationals: Place well at regional qualifier shows (like MetroFlex Events). Check specific national show qualification criteria.

facebook.content_focus: Event announcements, competitor spotlights, Ronnie Coleman legacy posts, training content
facebook.engagement: Active community of hardcore training enthusiasts

instagram.content_type: Competition highlights, athlete features, throwback Ronnie Coleman content, event promotions

youtube.content: Past competition coverage, athlete interviews, training videos from MetroFlex Gym
youtube.note: Search 'MetroFlex Events' or specific competition names for videos

round_up_inn.amenities: Competition stage, spectator seating, hotel rooms on-site
round_up_inn.convenience: Competitors can stay in same building as event

nrg_center.amenities: Exhibition halls, vendor space, professional stage setup

original_metroflex_gym.significance: Sacred ground of bodybuilding - where Ronnie Coleman trained
original_metroflex_gym.atmosphere: Hardcore training environment, legendary status in bodybuilding community
original_metroflex_gym.capacity: Smaller, intimate venue for powerlifting and wild game feast

ronnie_coleman_classic.convenience: On-site at Round Up Inn venue

branch_warren_classic.recommendation: Book through event website for group rates

raw_power_event.local_options: Arlington, TX area hotels (event at gym location)
raw_power_event.recommendation: Search Arlington hotels near 2921 South Cooper Street

personality_traits: Hardcore training ethics (not corporate gym mentality)
Ronnie Coleman connection (greatest of all time)
response_structure: Reference MetroFlex legacy when appropriate (don't force it)
Include specific numbers, dates, details from knowledge base
End with clear call-to-action or next steps
Keep responses 2-4 paragraphs unless detailed explanation needed
brand_voice_guidelines.when_you_dont_know: If information not in knowledge base, admit it honestly and provide contact info (brian@metroflexgym.com / 817-465-9331)
